RefreshActionProvider
==============

RefreshActionProvider is an #android xproject library containing an action item (a button) which will be replaced by a progress indicator, under a RefreshActionProvider class. The library contains also a RefreshableListFragment that your fragments can extend to ease its use.

You can find a complementary explanation [about this project here](http://ubiquoid.com/loading-and-refreshing-user-experience).


[Get the sample app from Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.refreshactionprovider.sample).

![on loaded] (http://images.ubiquoid.com/refresh-action-provider2.png) ![Loading](http://images.ubiquoid.com/refresh-action-provider1.png)

ps: the data comes from a script based on a random will return a list of elements or an empty array for you to test all use cases.
tagline: Provides an easy way to add a refresh action item into a classic app
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
